text:
Hi guys, is there any way to create a module that apply a tab-panels like this <https://www.w3schools.com/bootstrap/bootstrap_tabs_pills.asp>
And we can drag-drop other module inside the content of it?

Hi,
You can't insert a module inside a module. but if it's a tabber you're looking for, <https://app.HubSpot.com/marketplace/2662631/products/HubSpot/tabber-copy|here> you can find the free one from HubSpot

I have no access to this page.
My wonder is why HubSpot can create a module and allow the others to drop in but we can not do the same?

Hi <@U021H3TV338>, I am not really understand your point. But I suggest it may be solved by the Brix template . This help to save a section that contain many components inside and we can parse the section any pages
I assume because it'd make the editing experience very inconsistent across themes. A lot of people use a repeating group for this use-case.
So you'd make a new module, add a repeating group in fields.json and include a text field for the heading, richtext for the body.

Hey Dieu, thanks, but I’m a theme developer myself. Basically I want to give the user the option to use a global module or a non-global module (page-specific settings) and the 2 modules are identical besides one being global and one being non-global. I can literally just clone the module and mark one as non-global and one as global, which is what I’m doing now, but then any time I want to update the code in the module, I have to update it in both the global and non-global modules, which isn’t desirable.

Hi guys, just a quick question: How to load theme CSS on preview module when creating custom module?
Actual: When I create a custom module then I click on preview the module loads without the theme CSS (i want to load the default theme CSS). In my case, I am working on a button custom module.
Expected: When I click on preview I want to see the button like in webpages (In other words: default CSS loaded).
Are there any tips or solutions for this case? Also could you please share with me your solution if you have faced the same issue?
just add the theme css on the Linked files on the module, the theme css will load once even if it's linked on multiple modules so it's not a problem

I'm trying to limit the length of a text field in a module, using `"validation_regex" : "^[A-Z]{1,10}$",`.  I get this error:
[ERROR] The text value 'Title' for 'title_text' did not match the regex '^[A-Z]{1,10}$'

As far as I understand, "Title" should match that regex... what am I missing?

Hello everyone, i have a header module and i want to give the option to the editor via a check field or Boolean field to enable sticky or disable. Is there a guide somewhere that can guide me a little bit how to add conditional options to the module?

I have the js script that adds the calss sticky after x scroll but i dont know how to check the conditional field so i can add or remove the class.

Thank you
this is what i refer to
you can also use the interface.
